result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel Vasquez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at $50.00 per month commencing 08/03/15 and each month thereafter or penalty of 8 days jail for non-payment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel Vasquez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Daniel Vasquez in court with Attorney Joseph Smith.  Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Smith makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  FINE:  $378.20 - to be paid at $50.00 per month, commencing 8/3/15, alternate 8 days jail if not paid.

ADDRESS INFO for Daniel Vasquez
Current: 221 Arcadian Street, Waukesha, WI 53186 United States  (Effective: 05-08-2015)
Prior: 221 A Arcadian Street, Waukesha, WI 53186

Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness or the residence listed in the Criminal Complaint. He may get his belongings only with a officer or his probation agent present at the residence.  MODIFIED CONDITION:  Defendant to have no VIOLENT or assaultive behavior with victim.

Defendant Daniel Vasquez in court with Attorney Joseph Smith.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Becky Van Dam appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Smith requests an adjournment and states that victim is present today and is requesting bail to be modified to No violent contact.  State objects to request.  Victim makes statements.  Court modifies bail conditions.  Hearing scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness or the residence listed in the Criminal Complaint. He may get his belongings only with a officer or his probation agent present at the residence.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Daniel Vasquez in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 10:00 am.
